description: The most generic type of item.

contents.name: additionalType
contents.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

contents.name: disambiguatingDescription
contents.description: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

contents.name: identifier
contents.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.
contents.comment: Schema.org Type: PropertyValue or Text or URL

contents.name: image
contents.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

contents.name: mainEntityOfPage
contents.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details. Inverse property: mainEntity

contents.name: potentialAction
contents.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
contents.comment: Schema.org Type: Action -> TODO Replace with relationship to Action model

contents.name: sameAs
contents.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

contents.name: subjectOf
contents.description: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing. Inverse property: about
contents.comment: Schema.org Type: CreativeWork or Event -> TODO Replace with relationship?
